title: 1580-A
statement: A. Portaltime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputCQXYM found a rectangle $$$A$$$ of size $$$n \\times m$$$. There are $$$n$$$ rows and $$$m$$$ columns of blocks. Each block of the rectangle is an obsidian block or empty. CQXYM can change an obsidian block to an empty block or an empty block to an obsidian block in one operation.A rectangle $$$M$$$ size of $$$a \\times b$$$ is called a portal if and only if it satisfies the following conditions:$$$a \\geq 5,b \\geq 4$$$.For all $$$1 < x < a$$$, blocks $$$M_{x,1}$$$ and $$$M_{x,b}$$$ are obsidian blocks.For all $$$1 < x < b$$$, blocks $$$M_{1,x}$$$ and $$$M_{a,x}$$$ are obsidian blocks.For all $$$1<x<a,1<y<b$$$, block $$$M_{x,y}$$$ is an empty block.$$$M_{1, 1}, M_{1, b}, M_{a, 1}, M_{a, b}$$$can be any type.Note that the there must be $$$a$$$ rows and $$$b$$$ columns, not $$$b$$$ rows and $$$a$$$ columns.Note that corners can be any typeCQXYM wants to know the minimum number of operations he needs to make at least one sub-rectangle a portal.InputThe first line contains an integer $$$t$$$ ($$$t \\geq 1$$$), which is the number of test cases.For each test case, the first line contains two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$m$$$ ($$$5 \\le n \\le 400$$$, $$$4 \\le m \\le 400$$$).Then $$$n$$$ lines follow, each line contains $$$m$$$ characters $$$0$$$ or $$$1$$$. If the $$$j$$$-th character of $$$i$$$-th line is $$$0$$$, block $$$A_{i,j}$$$ is an empty block. Otherwise, block $$$A_{i,j}$$$ is an obsidian block.It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$n$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$400$$$.It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$m$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$400$$$.OutputOutput $$$t$$$ answers, and each answer in a line.ExamplesInput1 5 4 1000 0000 0110 0000 0001Output12Input1 9 9 001010001 101110100 000010011 100000001 101010101 110001111 000001111 111100000 000110000Output5NoteIn the first test case, the final portal is like this:11101001100110010111

processed.result:
You are given a rectangle of size $n \times m$ filled with blocks. Each block is either obsidian (1) or empty (0).  

You can change an obsidian block to empty or an empty block to obsidian in one operation.

A rectangle of size $a \times b$ is a portal if:

* $a \ge 5$ and $b \ge 4$
* All blocks in the second and second-to-last columns are obsidian.
* All blocks in the first and last rows are obsidian.
* All other blocks are empty.

Find the minimum number of operations needed to create at least one portal in the rectangle.

Input:

* The first line contains the number of test cases, $t$.
* For each test case:
    * The first line contains two integers, $n$ and $m$ ($5 \le n \le 400$, $4 \le m \le 400$).
    * The next $n$ lines contain $m$ characters, '0' or '1', representing the blocks.

Output:

* For each test case, output the minimum number of operations needed to create a portal.

You are given a grid of squares. Some squares are black, some are empty.  You can change a black square to empty or an empty square to black.  Find the fewest changes needed to make a rectangle of at least 5 rows and 4 columns where:

* The left and right edges of the rectangle are all black.
* The top and bottom edges of the rectangle are all black.
* The inside of the rectangle is all empty.
